title: Mobile Medical and Eye Care Unit
mini_description: Mobile healthcare service bringing medical and eye care directly to remote villages for elderly Sri Lankans
main_content: Thousands of elderly Sri Lankans suffer needlessly because they lack access to medical and eye care mainly due to mobility and financial issues. HASL has embarked on a project since 2006 to provide medical and eye care facilities to needy elders in their own villages through the Mobile Medical Unit (MMU).

key_details.capacity: 150 elders per camp (75 eye + 75 medical screenings)
key_details.equipment: Latest medical and eye care equipment

key_issues: Lack of access to medical and eye care
program_benefits: Provides free spectacles and surgery referrals
achievements: Capacity to screen up to 450 elders per day with extended staff

title: HelpAge Eye Hospital
mini_description: Sri Lanka's only private hospital providing free daily cataract surgeries for underprivileged seniors
main_content: Located in Wellawatte, Colombo 6, the HelpAge Eye Hospital is the flagship project of HelpAge Sri Lanka, providing free cataract surgeries using advanced phacoemulsification systems since 2009.

key_details.methods_used: Phacoemulsification with Stellaris Vision Enhancement system
key_details.capacity: 20 cataract surgeries per day (300 per month)

key_issues: Risk of blindness due to delayed surgeries

title: Youth Education Programmes
mini_description: Building bridges between generations through awareness and education in schools
main_content: The Youth Education Programme (YEP) aims to connect the younger generation with elders by fostering respect, empathy, and awareness about ageing issues through school-based initiatives.

title: The Struggle for Survival: An Urgent Call for Action to Save Sri Lanka's Senior Citizens
mini_description: Addressing the severe impact of Sri Lanka's economic collapse on vulnerable elderly population
main_content: Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis has severely impacted older people, limiting access to food, medicine, and basic necessities. HelpAge Sri Lanka calls for urgent interventions to protect this vulnerable group.

key_details.target_group: Older men and women affected by the crisis

program_benefits: Highlights urgent elder issues during crisis

title: Elders in Remote Villages Around Medirigiriya Reap Benefit from HelpAge Eye Hospital
mini_description: Extending free cataract surgery services to remote villages in the Medirigiriya region
main_content: HelpAge Eye Hospital extended its free cataract surgery program to underserved elders in Medirigiriya, performing over 100 surgeries for villagers who lacked access to timely medical attention.
key_issues: Delay in surgeries at government hospitals
activities: Special clinics on 10th Dec 2022 and 7th Jan 2023
Transport and meals provided by local volunteers
achievements: More than 400 elders identified for treatment
